title: Reflective Learning Design Simulation for English Teacher Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Secondary English Curriculum and Teaching Methodologies
context.additional_context: Process focused on developing English teachers' professional expertise and reflective planning competencies to respond to frequent curriculum changes.

learning_goals: Participants can understand the five stages of the Dreyfus model (novice-to-expert) and apply corresponding planning types (practical/external reflection/internal reflection) to real educational contexts
Participants can design and implement reflective planning strategies across diverse curriculum change scenarios through VR simulation

Participants analyze their project planning methods using a 5-stage analytical framework (goal setting, resource allocation, risk management, execution monitoring, outcome evaluation) based on ≥3 peer feedback instances and write a reflective practice report meeting ≥2 of 3 expert review criteria (clarity, practicality, improvement potential).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
